text: Wałbrzych (pronounce: ['vawbʒix], German: Waldenburg) is a town in southwestern Poland in the Lower Silesian Voivodeship. About 126 000 people live there and the area is 84 km². The city belonged to Germany until 1945. The original German population was expelled after WW II. Category:Cities in Lower Silesian Voivodeship
title: Wałbrzych
